name: Gate Drill
description: Place two tees just wider than your putter to create a gate. Practice rolling putts through the gate to improve your starting line accuracy.

name: Chip & Check
description: Pick a landing spot and chip to it repeatedly. Check your results and adjust until you can consistently hit your target.

name: Alignment Stick Drill
description: Place alignment sticks on the ground to guide your swing path. Practice swinging along the proper path to improve ball-striking consistency.

name: Distance Control Ladder
description: Putt to progressively longer distances, focusing on speed control. Try to get each putt within a putter length of the target.

name: Towel Drill
description: Place a towel behind the ball. Practice hitting shots without hitting the towel to ensure ball-first contact and improve strike quality.

name: Coin Behind Ball
description: Place a coin behind your ball. Practice hitting putts while avoiding the coin to develop a clean, forward-striking motion.

name: One-Handed Chipping
description: Practice chipping with only your lead hand to develop better feel and control. This drill helps improve touch around the greens.

name: Punch Shot Drill
description: Practice hitting low, penetrating punch shots. Keep your hands ahead and finish low to control ball flight in windy conditions.

name: Up & Down Challenge
description: Practice getting up and down from various locations around the green. Track your success rate to improve your short game performance.

name: Clock Drill
description: Place balls around the hole like a clock face. Make all putts in succession to build confidence and handle pressure on short putts.
